unnormalised: Vrindavan saw a massive influx of devotees for Janmashtami celebrations on 06/09/2023, with estimates suggesting over 10 lakh pilgrims visited the holy town. Hotels reported 100% occupancy rates, and the local administration made special arrangements for crowd management. The Banke Bihari Temple remained open till 1:00 AM to accommodate the large numbers.
normalised: Vrindavan saw a massive influx of devotees for Janmashtami celebrations on sixth september two thousand and twenty three, with estimates suggesting over one million pilgrims visited the holy town. Hotels reported one hundred percent occupancy rates, and the local administration made special arrangements for crowd management. The Banke Bihari Temple remained open till one a m to accommodate the large numbers.

unnormalised: The Uttar Pradesh State Road Transport Corporation (UPSRTC) ran extra buses from Delhi, Agra, and Mathura. Train services on the Delhi-Agra route also saw a surge in passengers, with most trains running at full capacity. Many devotees opted for private taxis and auto-rickshaws, leading to traffic congestion on the NH-44.
normalised: The Uttar Pradesh State Road Transport Corporation (U-P-S-R-T-C) ran extra buses from Delhi, Agra, and Mathura. Train services on the Delhi-Agra route also saw a surge in passengers, with most trains running at full capacity. Many devotees opted for private taxis and auto-rickshaws, leading to traffic congestion on the N-H- forty four.

unnormalised: Local businesses reported a brisk trade in sweets, religious paraphernalia, and souvenirs. A Peda, a local sweet, was selling for Rs. 20 a piece near the temple. While the celebrations were largely peaceful, police reported a few minor incidents of pickpocketing and overcrowding, urging pilgrims to remain cautious and follow safety guidelines.
normalised: Local businesses reported a brisk trade in sweets, religious paraphernalia, and souvenirs. A Peda, a local sweet, was selling for rupees twenty a piece near the temple. While the celebrations were largely peaceful, police reported a few minor incidents of pickpocketing and overcrowding, urging pilgrims to remain cautious and follow safety guidelines.
